title: When someone who doesn't play a champion argues with a one trick

replies.body: Feel free to ask me about extra virgin olive oil.
What is it that makes it _extra_ virgin, and what does it mean by virgin in the first place?
It probably gets extra virgin from playing League of Legends. that's how it went down for me, at least.

Extra virgin olive oil is oil made from the first press of the olives, and typically purified. That's oil better meant for salad dressings, baking, and dipping.

Regular olive oil is from the further presses of the olives. That's the better oil for cooking and sauces.
What is the ritual to make it SUPER extra virgin olive oil?

Even worse when you play your one trick in normal games.

"Do you have nothing else to do than ruining my normal games?"
"You have no life b*tch, play ranked"
"Isn't it a slow way to master, when playing normal games?"

I like the last one most, get it in 1 of 5 games, like am I not allowed to play normal games with the only champ that is fun to me just because of my name? :(

And then when you don't play that champ in normals cause you want to abuse a strong champ to get a hextech chest. 

"_wtf no Ahri?_"
I have not got a single chest in weeks, because I almost only play Taliyah. Can't help it when she is the only champ that's fun to me tho.

This is how it comes across to others if that player isn't playing the supposed champion they one-trick

http://miriamruiz.es/img/MatildaImRightYoureWrong.gif

That depend's on the definition of "one trick". True one tricks usually don't get very far elo wise because in order to truly know the champion you play, you have to know how to play against it. There is a difference between some ape who plays nothing but Rengar and the OTP called Annie Bot.

In high elo, in low elo one trick ponies can execute their mechanics decently but have no idea how to team fight with their champ or how to build them optimally for the mid-late game based on the enemy comp.
but the feeling when the random scrub is right but the onetrick is wrong
